basics.name: Philippe CARLE
basics.label: Tech Lead
basics.summary:
**Professional Tech Lead with 15+ years of experience as a freelancer, a Lead Developer in a startup and now in an international industrial group. Proficient in PHP, Javascript and Go.**

As a Tech Lead, my goal is to find the most efficient way to implement and deliver the requested features while maintaining a high level of quality and maintainability and helping my team grow. I am business-driven, I have a strong technical leadership and good communication skills.

This resume is maintained using the JSON Resume initiative for JSON-based standard for resumes ([Github Repository](https://github.com/philippecarle/resume). I am a French citizen and a Permanent Resident of Canada.

work.summary:
[TLD Group](https://www.tld-group.com) is a leading industrial company specializing in the design, manufacture, distribution, after sales service and support of aviation ground support equipment.

TLD's intranet can be considered as a second ERP. It is highly interconnected with the company's ERP and most employees of the group are using it as their main work tool. Due the the challenging industrial environment, the business complexity is very high and the development team is deeply involved in a lot of business processes to support the evolution of the intranet as well as the customer and suppliers web portals.

One of my missions is to lead and provide innovative and efficient solutions to support the progressive migration of a ~1M LOC of an old procedural PHP legacy codebase to the Symfony framework and to make it compatible with successively PHP 7 and PHP 8.

TLD started an ERP migration in 2021 and I have been working to design an elegant, comprehensive and battle-tested solution to address the paradigm shift induced between our previous on-premise ERP (Baan IV) and the new cloud-based one (Infor LN) and I drove a smooth transition in the web portals connection to the company software.

I am leading an international team through multiple timezones, I have been successfully hiring new talents in the team, I made sure that code reviews were strict yet empathetic, I contributed to task prioritization, specifications and I hqve been collaborating several with highly qualified external contractors.
highlights: SDLC, Testing, CI/CD, devops, code reviews, best practices
Symfony progressive migration of a legacy codebase
ERP migration from Baan IV to Infor LN

work.summary:
Apodis Pharma is an innovative company providing several B2B services for over a thousand French pharmacies. 

With my team of 10+ frontend and backend developers and designers, we developed a Symfony-based custom store for pharmacies supporting the [Pharma-ML XML standard](https://www.csrp.fr/documentation/pharma-ml) with an advanced cost and discount calculation system. Apodis was also providing a lot of KPIs, metrics and forecasts to support the activity of their customers, based on the processing of a large amount of sales data coming from the pharmacies' ERP.

All the applications we built during those years helped Apodis raise 7M‚Ç¨.
highlights: Management and coaching of a large team

references.name: Gregory Gautry - IT Group Director at TLD
references.reference:
As IT Director, it is very interesting and efficient to work with Philippe. 
Philippe is able to step back from the technical aspect of things and face the customers to collect their pains and their needs. Philippe is solution-oriented, trying to find the best compromise between the technical debt and the impact on the business.
On another side, Philippe is eager to bring continuous improvement on both technical and non-technical side of the job. For instance, we worked together on building templates to ease collection of functional requirements.
He is a very good point of contact for the team even if he is not their manager.
He voices topics no matter if they are good or bad so we can sit around the table and identify ways to improve or grab opportunities. He is very dedicated to make things work.
As an ex IT Tech person, I like to discuss design and technology with Philippe. He is very knowledgeable, with a DevOps approach of things: we build things to make them stable and smooth to operate and improve. He is used to cover functional specifications through, design, implementation, CI/CD, release management, communication... 
He is constantly investing on improving his toolbox - for instance he recently attended to Scrum Master trainings to go deeper on that aspect of the job.
In short words, Philippe is a passionated and invested expert in web applications, with a very human approcach focusing on making things better, smoother and more sustainable.

references.name: Philippe Khill - former manager at TLD
references.reference:
I had the chance to work with Philippe Carle for a few months. I really appreciated his professionalism, his ability to listen and his kindness, which are essential qualities for a lead-developer. 
The discussions I was able to have with Philippe were very enriching, technically and humanly speaking. I hope we will be able to work together again soon.

references.name: Martin Degenne - Fomer team member at TLD
references.reference:
After working in his team for almost 2 years, I can say without a doubt that Philippe Carle is an excellent Lead Developer. 
During those two years, I spent at least an hour every week with him to follow my projects and find ways to deal with complex problems like optimization. He found time to teach me more about php and routing when I was struggling to understand parts of our technological stack and to listen to me when I had a different opinion about the best way to develop a solution. 
I know he was doing the same thing for everyone on the team but still never missed a meeting nor an important deadline despite the complicated and often tough environment. 
The team grew stronger thanks to him and I will happily work with him in the future if the opportunity presents itself.
